column16: Festuca ovina is a PERENNIAL growing to 0.3 m (1ft).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 5.  It is in flower from May to June. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Wind.  Suitable for: light (sandy) and medium (loamy) soils, prefers  well-drained soil and can grow in nutritionally poor soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils and can grow in very alkaline soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers dry or  moist soil and can tolerate drought.
column19: Seed: includes nuts, cereals, peas and beans.
column21: Seed[105, 161]. No further details but the seed is rather small and would be very fiddly to utilise[K].

column27: Prefers a light well-drained soil in full sun[200]. A drought resistant plant once established[1], it succeeds on shallow chalky soils[61]. Tolerant of constant cutting, this plant is often grown in lawns[1].
column28: Seed - sow spring in situ[162]. The seed usually germinates within three weeks. Division in spring[162]. Very easy, the clumps can be replanted direct into their permanent positions.
